author: swhitenstall
title: Catalyst Audit Circle
description: 催化剂公司缺乏一个管理圈，其重点是围绕资助提案的审计问题的问题感应优先次序。

f6_assessments.q0:
缺乏治理通常是造成组织内部或项目执行过程中流程缺失、肥大或误用的原因。这项建议确定了以明确和一致的方式对与审计过程有关的问题进行优先处理的问题。一个专注于审计过程的专门圈子将连接IOHK和受资助提案之间的缺失环节，并为Catalyst社区提供更多的可见性和透明度。催化剂审计圈的任务是明确的，描述得很好，没有误解。
该提案的目标与挑战中的目标完全一致，因此我坚信它将有效地应对挑战。我给它打的分数是5分。
f6_assessments.q1:
这个提议背后的团队成员在Cardano生态系统中带来了丰富的经验，他们操作赌注池，在以前的基金中赢得了提议，或参与了其他催化剂圈子。由这样的成员组成的团队的成功是有保证的。
预算已经清楚地列出，并提供了详细的细分分析。要求的资金是合理的，不超过挑战赛总资金的7%。在同一章节中，还提供了详细的执行计划，描述了实现最终目标的所有必要活动。
建议书中缺少的部分之一是对可能的风险的识别。例如，当感觉到问题的优先次序有误时，可能会对 "催化剂 "项目产生什么影响？在IOG、监督小组和审计小组之间是否有任何薄弱点？以及如何缓解这些问题？如果从调查中得到的反馈较少，是否有其他方法来收集信息？
我同意这个建议将被成功实施，所以我给它打4分。
f6_assessments.q2:
该提案包括一个定义明确的路线图，在2-3个月的时间框架内有一套透明的活动。虽然缺少一个具体的关键绩效指标的部分，但该提案的成功仍然可以通过其指定的可交付成果来衡量。此外，由于这些信息分散在不同的章节中，因此对如何跟踪 "圈子 "的进展情况并不十分清楚。
我同意所提供的信息足以审计该提案的进展和成功，因此我给它打4分。

f6_assessments.q0: 首先，我们应该明白，这不是一个关于审计提案的建议。  相反，它是一个关于建立一个定期公布的工作机构的建议，以审计提案的审计过程。  它与本小组的另一项关于审计治理过程的提案（资助提案审计是该凳子的第四条腿）协同工作。  通过定期的公开会议，对资助的提案环境和工具的监测，以及对2个调查的处置，这个小组将在每轮资助中拿出大约一次报告。  它将允许管理界解决以下问题：系统中的不良行为者（以及处理他们的协议，包括上诉程序），审计和支付所面临的可扩展性问题，现有工具的可靠性，防止在现场工具开发和使用方面的重复工作，等等。
f6_assessments.q1: 这个团队已经制定了一个清晰的路线图（与他们的监督提案的路线图融为一体）和一个简明的预算，充分解决了创建大约100个工时的公共会议和5个可交付成果所需的资源，包括一个Fund8提案，以继续他们在2022年春季的工作。  该提案团队拥有执行该项目所需的成熟技能和工具，他们在 "催化剂圈 "和以前的资助提案中的作用就是证明，他们有机会接触社区，这对吸引公众参与、执行调查和促进为最终报告收集信息所需的回顾性研究是必要的。
f6_assessments.q2: 他们将使用已经为社区对Catalyst Circle的监督提供透明度和清晰度的工具。5个交付物，分布在2个调查、1个回顾、1个基金建议和1个报告中，提供了一个容易监测的生产力和有效性的时间表，并有自然的审计点，与社区内已经定期发生的事件保持同步，如市政厅。团队本身也定期对社区负责，作为资助提案人、当选的 "催化剂圈 "代表和工具制造者和导师。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly mention how it will add value to solve the problem by providing reports on the development and implementation of the funded projects in Catalyst. Moreover, the team will also directly engage with the community to have survey and audit the funded proposal in Catalyst. This will bring better key metrics to measure the progress of funded proposal. And also could identify the bad actors within Project Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1:
Team consists of experienced people in Catalyst. Budget is outlined clearly & broken down properly in the proposal. And the team also provide plan for the next phase including the request for additional fund. 

Additionally, the proposal put realistic time frame to complete the work within 3 months. So, I think this proposal will be implemented properly if funded.
f6_assessments.q2:
The project progress could be tracked via GitHub repository and also GitBook link. And also the roadmap after getting funded is describe in the proposal. It will be great if the team could add milestones more clearly for each month. 

I really like that the team will engage directly with the community and do survey. That means the community could directly give feedback & track their project too.

f6_assessments.q0:
Great Idea! Having a board of people focused on improving auditing is something that cardano community and project catalyst would utilize! With the increased number of proposals, it will be more difficult to have oversight, therefore a governed board can definitely make a difference. 

I believe that such an outcome can increase the overall audit of funded projects.  Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
the experience of the mentioned team is pretty solid, with no doubt they can deliver. It would be nice to see some linked-in links, just to increase the credibility, but sounds okay. 

The plan is broken down in reasonable detail and in a reasonable time frame.

The budget seems slightly overextended. If I calculated correctly, each person will receive 80 dollars/hour. survey is for 1600 (this would require more detail, why survey cost this amount) Also, the amount for a report of 800 dollars = It would be nice to see these budget/outcomes in more detail, so a voter has a better idea about the outcomes. All of these can be very well thought, but it is not clear from the proposal how "well" and "reasonable" is a budget designed. 

 Rating given 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
Key metrics and the plan are provided. Since it is a transparent project, it will be easy to audit the progress, and based on results we can verify if they deliver what is planned. 

But what about self-funding in the future? any possibility? Also, a key metrics about the number of active members, or audited proposals? These would be interesting to measure too, to compare price/efficiency :) 

Rating given 4.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about establishing a Catalyst auditing circle to guide improvements needed to maximise each funding rounds return on intention. This solution is clearly defined, addresses the challenge, shows the clear impact on contributing to the Catalyst Auditability in certain aspects. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's impact, I would rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q1: The Catalyst Audit Circle includes active members of the Catalyst, and their profile shows suitable skills and experiences for implementing this work. Besides, some members of this team got proposals funded in the prior fund [F5, F6]. This is proof of feasibility from the team profile. The roadmap and budget are clear and logical. Risk is not defined. After all, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility, I would rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a lot of meaningful information, with evidence for verification. However, there is a point that is unclear in the way information is provided, this is minor, I suppose, that is: The Catalyst Audit Circle is described as consisting of 8 members, however, only 7 members are listed ? After all, based on the given information, I still strongly agree with this proposal's auditability, I would rate it with a score of 5

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to better the Auditing process of funded proposals by creating the Catalyst Audit Circle. This is in line with the Challenge's problem statement, and will thus have a positive impact on the Catalyst ecosystem. The Catalyst Circle will be identifying problems and then find solutions by collaborating with the community. This way they hope to better the Auditability process of funded proposals. It is very important to track whether the funds allocated during each Fund round are used effectively to grow Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The Team is set out with their experience and qualifications. They have been successfully funded in previous funding rounds. Not many links are provided as proof. There are eight team members, it would be good to see what each one's responsibilities would be as this seems a bit much. But if it was set-out might have made sense. The budget is broken down properly and makes sense. The proposer does mention that additional funding will be required and has an identifiable plan for this. They have a plan laid out and it seems implementable. Resources are mentioned and are also in the budget. Risks and possible solutions are not discussed.
f6_assessments.q2: A road map with milestones are provided for in the proposal. These deliverables/outputs in their proposal can be used to measure success of the project. Aside from the report I am not certain if the community will be able to track the progress of the proposal. I assume it will be through online meetings where the community will be invited. Maybe next time make this clearer.

solution: 建立一个 "催化剂 "审计圈，以指导所需的改进，使每轮融资的意向回报最大化。
experience: 审计圈将由来自催化剂审计社区的成员组成。见详细计划。
